column4: for some reason, when I do "apt-get install kubuntu-desktop," it wants me to remove "ubuntu-desktop" - why is this - I want KDE, without getting rid of GNOME
how do I get KDE on Ubuntu?
AndCooll_: when I do that, it tells me I have to remove ubuntu-desktop
ubuntu-desktop is just a meta package, it pulls in all deps for the ubuntu desktop. the ubuntu-desktop package is safe to remove
when I install, it gives me a list of about 100 dependencies - why doesn't it just install these automatically?
because kubuntu-desktop is also a meta package, it pulls in the deps for a nice kde desktop
well it is not doing that right now - Synaptic is only installing a few packages that KDE depends on, and won't install the other dependencies
I install kde with sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop
Yes, open a term and do: sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop
That's what the kubuntu-desktop meta package was designed for.. so you wouldn't have to manually type in all the deps
What happens when you do sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop?
Are you certain you don't already have kubuntu-desktop?
positive
how would I test if I have kubuntu-desktop or not?
That's a good question. I suppose you could log out and see if KDE is in the gdm list of desktops.. I think it is the "Options" button
nope, not on the list
try this: dpkg -l kubuntu-desktop
not found
Then it's not installed.
I tried typing in "sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop adept (etc.)" to get all the dependencies, and it still didn't work - a longer list of dependencies
KDE is installed - I used aptitude instead of apt-get and it's all good
